title: What would you do if you were a potato? - Quora

response.answer_text: If one day I was spuddenly a potato, I’d be a little disorientatered. What follows is a lot of puns. I’ve never seen very much appeel in being a potato. It would certainly be a starch change from my old life. I yam not very thick skinned, so it probably wouldn’t go over well. I might peel a bit put out. I might even be a bit devastatered. I would have to hash it out with my parents first, but as long as I wasn’t incapacitatered, I would want to peel off from the family and find a new place to live. There’s a latka people and animals in my house, and I wouldn’t want to be eaten or be decapitatered by someone on accident. I wouldn’t be a hesitater, but I also wouldn’t be erootic. I would concentroot and make the right decision to stay or go. I’d probably move. Once I got to my new place, I might kick bake and watch some movies. Starch Trek, the Silence of the Yams, Starch Wars, (you know, that one with Darth Tater), some docyamentaries, you name it. There is a slight chance that being the first human potato could make me a celebrooty. That would make me extuberant. It could also get a bit irrootating. People might start asking questions. “Were you made in a laborootory? Did you have to have any limbs amputatered to become a potato? Who orchestatered the whole thing? Were your cells mutatered or something? Are you undergoing any trootment to become human again?” My prosperooty could disappear. I might just become so frustrooted that I would kill myself and frame someone from premeditatered murder. Then I might have a commemorootive statue made in my my honor, to remember the one and only potato man.

Andrew the Newfoundland Potato This story begins as night approaches, and a grandson and his grandpa are looking for a book to read before slumber. “Hey grandpa! Grandpa! Tell me a story!” “Sure, young Billy… Tonight, I have a verrrrryyy special story for you. This story is one of heroism and courage. Now get comfortable young Billy, because this book is quite long!” *grandpa pulls out a book from the bookshelf and slowly opens it while young Billy sits patiently near grandpa’s rocking chair* … And so the story began, In days of yore, from Britain’s shore, there once lived a humble potato farmer. This potato farmer, named Timothy, had sailed across the great sea in search of a land just fertile enough and just big enough to plant the greatest potato field in all the realm. Upon arriving in this newly discovered world, Timothy landed just nigh of Conception Bay. He struck the flag of old in this new land, as he believed it was just fertile enough and just big enough to yield the greatest potato in all the Kingdom. Where his flag had once flown, he gently let go from his hand an old, English-born potato that fell to the ground. The potato laid there in all it's glory as Timothy admired it; this one in particular was the only one he had brought from the old Kingdom. Timothy smiled, but he did not smile for the reason you may think. Just as time had guided Timothy to this new land, the potato would take many centuries to grow. Upon this potato becoming ripe, it would achieve miraculous things… …1812 came as the forgotten centuries had past. This new era had brought war to the lands and caused great destruction. But in the potato field that was just fertile enough and just big enough, a new life had been born; Andrew, the Potato of Newfoundland. This potato was like no other- it was a mighty one that stood 213cm tall. It had neither legs or arms, or even a head! But it could see everything and could hop using the gracefulness of it's luscious base. Andrew had all the classical signs of a well-establish potato; he had plopped off his vines in good manner and was prepared to take on the world. However, Andrew was born into a universe of chaos and destruction. As he hopped from one end of the field to the other, he discovered many of his brethren had not been harvested. The concerned Newfie inquired his fellow potatoes about the situation; “Dear brother, where have thy master gone?” His fellow potato, Thomas, glanced at him and spoke; “It is unbeknownst to me, brother, for he has been in Heaven for centuries. However, his great great great great great great grandson, George, is now our caregiver. But for the Upper colony, they hath’ summoned him to fight.” Stunned by the words of his brother, Andrew immediately knew George was in danger! A young, yet wise potato, he spoke to all; “I must rescue our great caregiver!” Thomas nodded his oval stump and gave sincere advice to his brother; “In the shed upon the green hill along the cobblestone path that curves slightly left, thou shall find the flag of old and a golden bell.” Andrew paused for a moment and then asked; “But what purpose will the bell serve?” Alas, Thomas had just given the most important advice any potato would ever need; “Ye potatoes are not alone, for we have bountiful quantities of friend and far few foe. When the time comes of great peril, use the bell and you shall not be forlorn.” And with these words, Thomas fell asleep for winter. Andrew took his wise saying to heart, and found the shed upon the green hill along the cobblestone path that curves slightly left. He grabbed the flag of old and the golden bell. His journey to find George had begun… …Hopping, hopping, hopping… He stumbled upon many villages that had been thrashed by the war; homes had been turned to ash, the sky was bleak, and there were no fellow potatoes in sight. Disturbed by the situation, Andrew covered his stump to avoid seeing the destruction and hopped with fear. Upon reaching a village by an unfamiliar water, he saw a great frontline; On one end of the river, the land had been ravaged in fire and soldiers could be seen holding on to their very lives as enemy soldiers fired on them. On the other side of the river, Andrew witnessed a massive army with a foreign flag, storming across the river. The Newfie potato decided to push towards the flag he was indeed familiar with. Using all his weight and perfectly shaped body, he laid on his side and began to roll towards the front…. He could hear the bullets going all around him! As the humans were aiming in every direction, he prayed with all his potato barnacles that he'd survive long enough to find George. And finally, he hit the river. This river was incredibly deep by potato standards. It was made even more impassable by the enemies hellbent on shooting him. Andrew looked both right and left, trying to find a way across. Today would be his lucky day, as he found a piece of tree bark to ride on. He pulled the bark out in front of him and used some tree branches to steer. Just as he was wise, Andrew was also crafty. With an undaunted stroke of courage, he sailed across the river as the entire world collapsed around him… …Upon reaching the shores of the other river, he quickly hopped to where his fellow comrades had been holding their last stand. They looked as if they had never seen life before, as the great potato was both large and well-defined. After a moment in awe, a soldier by the name of George greeted him with what little hope he had left; “Why on Earth would thou cross such a river of doom! We are certainly going to all be dead, eh?” The intelligent, yet determined potato, acknowledged the situation. “George, it is true that the battle favors the enemy. It is also true that they are swarming our position. Soon enough, we shall either become sweet pulp or heroes of the Kingdom. For we are all but surrounded, discord shall not sever our unity. With thistle, shamrock, rose entwine, the maple leaf will survive forever!” And with the golden bell that Thomas had sworn by, he let out a proud, yet humble ring… And all the world shook like it had been awakened. The trees, the foliage, and all the rocks came alive! Each one, with one heart, began to charge vehemently towards the enemy lines! Completely terrified, the enemies dropped their guns and ran as fast as they could. The trees swung as far as their plethora of arms would swing and turned the enemies into bowling pins. The plants tripped the enemies so that they fumbled in disarray. And the rocks threw themselves at the enemy vessels to weaken the ships! Before the night could be called, the enemy had vanished into retreat. Upon the sight of the fleeing invaders, Andrew the Newfoundland Potato, firmly struck the flag of old into the ground… As winter came and left, the brave potato became less heard throughout the dominion. His triumphant and celebrated days of defending his kingdom had long been subsided by time… But far from Britain’s shore, where there is a potato field just fertile enough and just big enough, there was once born a hero… *Grandpa closed his book, and sighed from tiredness. It was now approaching midnight, and young Billy had long been asleep. As he looked outside, he gazed the land with incredible pride; it was the field his forefathers had worked for centuries. In his immediate vision, there was a shed upon a green hill along a cobblestone path that curved slightly left.*

If I were a potato, I'd make certain that I escaped the bag! Ordinary potatoes are doomed to be eaten. Not me! I would be no ordinary potato. I'd be smarter than the average spud. I'd roll away, out of the bag, and hide underneath the drawer inside the cabinet. Nobody would be the wiser. I'd make sure nobody found me and I'd grow out my long lustrous, golden roots. That way I'd be too far gone by the time someone saw my tendrils peeking up between the drawers. By then I would be too soft for those humans to chop me up and put me in the oven. Ha Ha! Foiled! If I were a lucky potato, perhaps I would find myself being painted with a funny face by an especially creative member of the household and I would provide a few giggles when I was put onto a plate at mealtime as a joke.  I'd find myself being lovingly planted in the soil come morning time, where my sprouts would take root and I'd thrive and grow and make more potatoes. Perhaps in time, we could feed the world.

You know that feeling of being somewhere between awake and asleep, where you’re technically conscious, but with one foot in the dream-world still, and you’re still thinking with dream-logic? Well, I once had a bleary, confusing morning episode in which I was fully convinced I was, in fact, a potato. As I recall, I didn’t do much of anything. Mostly, I experienced a kind of dull concern, as I didn’t know how to get up, dressed, and downstairs; becoming a potato had rendered me limbless, you see. I spent a good chunk of time pondering possible solutions, and eventually decided my best bet was to gather whatever strength a potato might have and roll for it. I woke up more fully when I hit the floor. As much as I’d like to say I’d do great and wondrous deeds were I really to become a potato, I imagine that in actuality I’d do something quite like that - nothing particularly useful, with only mild alarm at my predicament. Potatoes are probably not the thinkers of the vegetable world.

I would make sure that all future Vice Presidents of the United States know how to spell my name. In the past, that has sometimes been a problem. In 1992, Vice President Dan Quayle corrected the spelling of 12-year old William Figueroa during a school visit in Trenton, New Jersey. Quayle changed the student’s correct spelling “potato” to “potatoe.”

I would stop complaining about growing in a dirt poor neighborhoodI would sue the makers of Potato Heads for cruelty.I would outlaw French friesI would purchase a couch to lay uponI would never get smashed in my lifeI would avoid pubs, especially in the U.K.I would encourage people to eat turnips, parsnips, and rutabaga.I would avoid the following, mayonnaise, ketchup, vinegar and sour cream.I would never call the Mrs. "My lovely Potato cakes"I would stay away from fast food places.

If I were a potato, I would grow and grow until I was old enough to be picked. Then I would keep my eyes open for the right chance to roll into the right position. Then I want to end up at the Owl Bar in San Antonio, NM USA.  as the tastiest side dish, green chili cheese fries for a green chili cheeseburger.  I never need to be the star attraction, but I can go out as the next best thing. Plus, bathing in Hatch green chili just can’t be wrong. What can I say? I’m a potato with dreams of grandeur… most likely, I will just end up as a chip off the old block.

Anything, eh? Hmm.. let's see. Step 1: Steal the Mona Lisa. I will replicate into 1 million cat-sized potatoes and steal the artwork. Then, I would form into a jet and fly to Montana. There I would hide for 13 days. Step 2: Make big ass crop circles I will send out my millions of clones to create mike-wide crop circles on all major farms in the US. By now the country is going crazy. “Aliens? Could it be true?” Step 3: Draw a dragon on the moon Why not? Might as well freak out NASA. Again, the country is convinced that aliens are targeting the human race (even with this harmless prank) Final step: Overthrow the US government While they're distracted with everything else, my potato army will destroy Washington D.C. We will launch nukes at Russia and start WW3. R.I.P. Humanity. Potatoes are clearly superior. Hey, endless abilities, right?

Let's me think here ... Endless Abilities ... I'll choose Omnipresence, Omnipowerful, and Omniknowing.Wait! That makes me a God - Yes! That's it! I'm a Potato God!Yay! I can do anything I want! I can make anybody and anything else do what I want!OK - I'm vain, I can have no other Gods before me. Thus I smite all the other Gods. Poof! They're gone!Now, I'm am not only a Potato God, but with all the other Gods gone, I am THE only God!But somewhere in the Galaxy, I remember hearing proof of the NON existence of God ... searching ... searching ... Here it is - in a YouTube Video:  And now I'm gone too ... vanished in a puff of logic!Seems like a strange way to commit suicide, but hey!

If i were a potato then there is nothing to do.Because a potato is lifeless and can not do anything at it’s will.Basically,it does not even have will power.  So,if I were born as a potato,if I survived the pesticides,germicides,mole attacks,animal attacks,pre-mature death,I would just be in the farm first,then in the supermarket,later in somebody’s refrigerator ,after that on somebody’s plate and finally in someone’s mouth.  And if the eater were a person unworthy of living,I would just toxicate him[basically food poison him/her.].  That you can say is “LIFE OF POTATO,THE UNTOLD STORY”. Have a nice day .

You might think that being a potato is a half-baked idea, but I can see how it might have a peel. I could say that I only have "eyes" for you. I could say "this spud's for you". I'd put videos of myself on YouTuber. I wouldn't do drugs, though - no "hash" browns and I wouldn't get French "fried".

If I MUST be a potato which actually does something, pleaseeee let me be a Sontaran! Okay technically that's not an actual potato, but then again, an actual potato can't really do anything anyways. The things I could do as a Sontaran and the adventures I can be a part of… fantastic!

Considering that a potato is part of the root system of a plant, there would be nothing that it could do. Root systems cannot have “endless capabilities”. This is a question for which there is no possible answer. I hope this is a troll question because if it isn't, the OP needs some serious help.

Thanks for the A2A, Jeremy. This is one I would not even have considered replying to without it. But all yesterday, I daydreamed about the life of a potato. I’d lie in the earth, smelling it, feeling the lush, richness of the soil. I’d watch the worms inch through this underworld, the insects crawling through their brief lives. I’d feel coursing through my body the vibrations of cars, tractors and other large vehicles. My tendrils would feel the air, the rain, the sun and all the wondrous processes of photosynthesis. I’d hope I was a Yukon Gold. But if I am an ordinary Russet, I’d try to be the best ordinary Russet. I’d dream about life aboveground, the airplanes, kites, and birds — what do they look like beyond the beaks that I see pecking for the worms? Then, one day, the spade will come for me. Will it hurt? I hope not. I hope it’s fast and merciful. But until then, I will be the best potato I know how to be.

Erm. Grow. Live a long, tranquil life, then either get eaten and return to the earth that way, or decompose and do it the other way. Presumably I might adjust the acidity of the soil or increase the rainfall or something, but what kind of interests does a potato really have? Honestly, I’d do pretty much what I’m doing as a human without endless abilities.

I shall grow, forever, until I have subsumed every last drop of water, every breath, every inch of the ground upon which you tread. And I will shine, resplendent like a thousand suns, and the universe shall behold my splendor.

I would be the best and most tasty potato ever!!! They would build a potato Mt Rushmore just for me! …….and of course I would be topped with lots of yummy bacon. And cheese. And sour cream. Dang…. now I want a potato!!!!!
I’d keep my eyes peeled.

To be the frenchiest fry there ever was. To be the bottle of vodka whose fumes would be enough to knock you down. To be the bowl of mashed potatoes that you would kill for. (I am, infact, an animate potato, and these are, for real, my life goals)

Spend the rest of my immortal days creating micro universes on a top of the snowiest mountain in Tibet. There i would reside in my temple of Potatodon waiting on adventurers and truth seekers to beseech my wisdom so i can enlighten them.
Go roller skating
My goal would be to get a complete Mr. Potato Head Set, and get an agent to shop my book on ‘Recipes for Cannibals’
To be cooked up and made as delicous hashbrowns. If I'm lucky I'll be eaten with bacon. Oh what a life.
Aaaah, simple. I would sit on a couch and earn the title couch potato. Rightfully.
Cant believe no one else has posted this pic at all
